narrative: Let me share a story from when I was twenty-one years old. I was living in a small apartment near the city center. I had just started my first job. And uh I was working as a graphic designer. My father, who was recovering from a surgery, hadn't been out in – in uh – well I'd say about eight months. He had to use a wheelchair to get around. The only person there with him during the day was a kind neighbor, a lady in her sixties. My younger sister was away at college – so it was just my dad and the neighbor lady at home during the day. One day, I got this strong feeling while I was at work. It told me: "If you go to the nearby park during your lunch break and pray for your father's recovery, he'll start to improve." I looked around my office. I didn't see anyone nearby. So, I went to the park during my break and found a quiet spot there. That feeling came back again. I looked around once more. I still didn't see anyone nearby but I decided to take a chance. I wasn't too far from my office, maybe a ten-minute walk. I found a bench to sit on and closed my eyes – uh – uh – that feeling came back once more. I just took a deep breath. I was sitting under a big oak tree now. I looked up at the branches above me. Nobody was around. And uh I said to myself, well now, I had been taught that prayers can make a difference. And that it doesn't hurt to try. I knew I wasn't perfect, but I wanted to help my dad. I'd admit that to anyone. But I was willing to give it a try. I looked around one more time and then I closed my eyes and said a quiet prayer. I whispered, "God, I don't know if you're listening. But I ask you to please help my father recover. So he can regain his independence and enjoy life again." I opened my eyes and went back to work. Suddenly, I received a text message from my father. It said, "I just took a few steps with my walker." I – I couldn't believe it. It felt like a sign that my prayer had been heard. I rushed home after work and saw my father standing in the living room with the help of his walker. He hadn't been able to do that in months without assistance. And there he was, taking small steps. That was the turning point in his recovery. He continued to improve and regained most of his mobility within a year. It's been, what, six or seven years since then? My father is now able to walk without any assistance. He's living life to the fullest, even in his seventies.

recalls segmented.63ebbd2e45a16584b49227f1:
1. Story from when I was twenty-one years old.
2. Living in a small apartment near the city center.
3. First job.
4. Graphic designer.
5. My father, recovering from a surgery, hadn't been out in about eight months.
6. Used a wheelchair to get around.
7. Kind neighbor, lady in her sixties.
8. My younger sister at college – just my dad and the neighbor lady at home.
9. One day, strong feeling while I was at work.
10. It told me: "If you go to the nearby park during your lunch break and pray for your father's recovery, he'll start to improve."
11. I looked around my office.
12. I didn't see anyone nearby.
13. So, I went to the park during my break and found a quiet spot there.
14. Feeling came back again.
15. I looked around once more.
16. I still didn't see anyone nearby but I decided to take a chance.
17. I wasn't too far from my office, maybe a ten-minute walk.
18. I found a bench to sit on and closed my eyes feeling came back once more.
19. Took a deep breath.
20. A big oak tree now.
21. Nobody was around I said to myself, well now, I had been taught that prayers can make a difference.
22. Wanted to help my dad give it a try.
23. Closed my eyes and said a quiet prayer.
24. I whispered, "God, I don't know if you're listening. But I ask you to please help my father recover. So he can enjoy life again.
25. Went back to work.
26. Suddenly,received a text message from my father.
27. It said, "I just took a few steps with my walker."
28. I couldn't believe it.
29. Sign that my prayer had been heard.
30. Rushed home and saw my father standing in the living room.
31. And there he was, taking small steps.
32. Turning point in his recovery.
33. Continued to improve and regained most of his mobility.
34. Six or seven years since then?
35. My father now able to walk without any assistance.
36. He's living life to the full, even in his seventies.
recalls segmented.5ea015577dd57200089eb811:
1. 21 yr old male graphic designer,
2. sister away at college,
3. father recovering from surgery
4. but only the father and a kind neighbour were together during the day at home.
5. Son at work one day
6. and he felt he was being told to pray for his father in his lunch break.
7. He went to the park,
8. there was no one else around
9. and sat on a bench under a big oak tree
10. and closed his eyes to ask God to help his father regain his independence.
11. Shortly after his father rang him to say he had taken a few steps with his walker which he had not managed before.
12. He rushed home after work
13. to find his father standing with his walker.
14. He continued to improve over the next 6 or 7 years
15. and is now fully enjoying life again in his 60’s.

recalls segmented.5fae55f1c1b83f2c4d05540d:
1. Let me tell you a story about when I was twenty one.
2. I was living in a small apartment outside of the city centre.
3. My father lived nearby with a live in nurse.
4. My younger sister was away in college so it was just the two of them.
5. My father was in a wheelchair and couldn't do a lot by himself.
6. One day I was at work in the office and I got this feeling that if I prayed for my father to get better then it would work.
7. It was an overwhelming feeling so I looked around the office to see if I could leave to go to the local park.
8. Nobody was around so I walked the ten minutes over and sat underneath the oak tree.
9. I looked up at the branches swaying and I got that feeling to pray again.
10. So I asked God to make my father better.
11. That day I got a text from my father saying "I just took three steps with my walker".
12. He had not been able to move without any assistance before then so I took it as a sign that my prayer worked.
13. This was seven or eight years ago and now he can walk without any assistance at all and lives life to the fullest.

2. at an office.

8. to help my father recover.

10. I went to the park.
11. No one was there
12. and it was quiet.
13. It was about 10 minutes from my office.
14. I took a deep breath under the oak tree
15. and said a prayer: "please god, help my father".
16. Thereafter, I received a text message from my father,
17. saying he took his first steps without a walking stick.
18. This was like the prayer had worked.

21. It was amazing,
22. a miracle answered.
recalls segmented.62c08c865b36cf4fbabf34d2:
1. The author's father was recovering from surgery.
2. He was being looked after by a neighbour, a woman in her sixties.
3. The author's sister was away at college.
4. One day at work the author had a premonition that if she went to the park and prayed, her father's health would improve.
5. As there was no-one else in the office, at lunchtime she went to the park, a ten minute walk away, and found a bench in a quiet corner.
6. She asked God to help.
7. When she got back to the office, she received a text from her father stating that he had a taken a few steps with the help of the neighbour.
8. When she got home, her father was standing with the aid of a walker.
9. Seven years later the father, then in his seventies, was back on his feet properly.
